Classical.Structure: Cortex folded deep within the lateral sulcus.
Classical.Function: Primary interoceptive cortex. Integrates bodily signals into subjective feelings, emotion, and self-awareness.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A key node in the brain's macroscopic quantum entanglement network (Salience Network). Its function is dependent on the global proton-spin entanglement (W > 1) that collapses during unconsciousness.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The mirror of the self, where the organism's inner state is reflected back to consciousness as 'feeling' or 'qualia'.

Falsification_Hypotheses: The Insula will show no loss of its quantum entanglement signature (W > 1) during general anesthesia, even as interoceptive awareness is lost.
Subjective reports of 'feeling' will not correlate with the entanglement signature of the Salience Network.
Experimental_Protocols: Advanced MQC-NMR (Kerskens, 2024) to measure the entanglement witness (W) in the Insula during interoceptive tasks (e.g., heartbeat detection).
